dm

Class Ui

  • java.lang.Object
    • dm.Ui

  • public class Ui
extends java.lang.Object
    The Ui class is responsible for managing and rendering various UI components in the application. It provides methods to draw images, shapes, text, and other UI elements on the screen.

    Dependencies:

    • DirectGraphics
    • Graphics
    • Image
    • Sprite
    • Ms
    • Constants_H

    Usage:

    To use the Ui class, follow these steps:

    1. Initialize the Ui instance using the constructor or the static method i().
    2. Initialize the graphics context using initGraphics(Graphics).
    3. Use the various drawing methods to render UI components on the screen.

    Methods:

    • initGraphics(Graphics): Initializes the graphics context.
    • drawRegion(Image, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, Graphics): Draws a region of an image.
    • drawModuleOne(Sprite, int, int, int, int, int): Draws a module of a sprite.
    • drawFrameOne(Sprite, int, int, int, int): Draws a frame of a sprite.
    • drawActionOne(Sprite, int, int, int, byte[], int, boolean): Draws an action of a sprite.
    • drawImage(Image, int, int, int): Draws an image.
    • drawImage(Image, int, int, int, int): Draws an image with transformation.
    • fillRect(int, int, int, int, int): Fills a rectangle with a color.
    • drawLine(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a line with a color.
    • drawRect(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a rectangle with a color.
    • #fillArc(int, int, int, int, int, int): Fills an arc with a color.
    • drawString(String, int, int, int, int, int): Draws a string with a color and mode.
    • drawStringColor(String, int, int, int, int): Draws a string with multiple colors.
    • drawStringY(StringBuffer[], int, int, int, int, int): Draws multiple strings vertically.
    • initUiModules(): Initializes UI modules.
    • drawUi(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a UI component.
    • drawBDir(int, int, int, int): Draws a directional button.
    • drawVolume(int, int, int, boolean): Draws a volume indicator.
    • drawK(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a filled rectangle with a specific color.
    • drawK0(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a bordered rectangle with a specific color.
    • drawK1(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a bordered rectangle with a different style.
    • drawK2(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a filled rectangle with a border.
    • drawK3(int, int, int, int): Draws a filled rectangle with a border and background color.
    • drawK4(int, int, int, int): Draws a bordered rectangle with a different style.
    • drawKuang(int, int, int, int): Draws a bordered rectangle with a background color.
    • drawKuangSelect(int, int, int, int, int): Draws a selectable bordered rectangle.
    • drawKuangMap(int, int, int, int, boolean): Draws a map bordered rectangle.
    • drawKuangAdorn(int, int, int, int, int): Draws an adorned bordered rectangle.
    • drawBarOne(int, int, int, int, int, int): Draws a progress bar.
    • sliding(int, int, int, int, int, boolean): Draws a sliding bar.
    • drawNum(String, int, int, int, int): Draws a number string.
    • drawRectZ(int, int, int, int, int, int): Draws a rectangle with a specific color and size.
    • fillRectB(): Fills the entire screen with a background color.
    • drawTriangle(int, int, int, boolean, boolean): Draws a triangle.
    • drawTriangle1(int, int, int, boolean, boolean): Draws a triangle with a different style.
    • drawYesNo(boolean, boolean): Draws Yes/No options.
    • drawYesNo_(boolean, boolean): Draws Yes/No options with a different style.
    • drawYesNo__(boolean, boolean): Draws Yes/No options with another style.
    • drawListSY(Object[], int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int): Draws a list of items vertically.
    • drawListKY(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int): Draws a list of items with a different style.
    • drawStringY(Object[], int, int, int, int, int, int, int): Draws multiple strings vertically with a specific range.
    • drawListSYHasSound(Object[], int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int): Draws a list of items with sound options.
